intro: Sphenogyne nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green to brown in color. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems and is often found in temperate regions. Sphenogyne nudicaulis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
